channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel Orders Residents of Baalbek in Eastern Lebanon to Evacuate
item.description: Israel’s military warned civilians to leave Baalbek in the Bekaa Valley via three routes. The city had largely been spared Israeli bombardment until t...

item.title: ‘Founder mode’ startup guru Paul Graham explains why he’s not backing Trump—‘He ran the White House like a mob boss’
item.description: Y Combinator co-founder Paul Graham calls Trump a 'crook' that cannot be trusted with the nation's highest office.

item.title: Democratic Lawyer Stymied Trump in 2020. Other Efforts Played Into G.O.P. Hands.
item.description: Marc Elias, hired to help Kamala Harris in election-related fights, helped to pave the way for big money in politics.

item.title: Harris’s Mission: Disqualify Trump, but Extend a Hand to His Voters
item.description: Kamala Harris, in her closing argument to voters, acknowledged an inescapable political reality: Donald Trump is not a fringe figure within his own pa...

item.title: Reeves lifts U.K. taxes by £40 billion in first Labour budget
item.description: “The scale and seriousness of the situation that we have inherited cannot be underestimated,” Reeves said in the House of Commons on Wednesday, the fi...

item.title: Tupperware’s sale to lenders approved by bankruptcy judge, keeping the iconic food containers on shelves
item.description: Under terms of the deal, a group of lenders is buying Tupperware’s brand name and various operating assets for $23.5 million in cash and more than $63...

item.title: At a Glitzy Saudi Investment Forum, Almost No Mention of War
item.description: Saudi Arabia and its Gulf neighbors are seeking to reassure foreign investors that it’s still safe to do business amid the turmoil around the Mideast.

item.title: Israel Demolished Hundreds of Buildings in Southern Lebanon, Videos and Satellite Images Show
item.description: At least 1,085 buildings have been destroyed or badly damaged since Israel’s invasion targeting the Hezbollah militia, including many in controlled de...

item.title: Europe Imposes Higher Tariffs on Electric Vehicles Made in China
item.description: The tariffs, some as high as 45 percent, are intended to protect Europe’s automotive sector, but they could escalate a trade war with China.

item.title: Why Malcolm Gladwell decided it was time for ‘Revenge’
item.description: From bank robberies to the opioid crisis, Malcolm Gladwell's 'Revenge of the Tipping Point,' digs into why epidemics spread around America.

item.title: Trump and Vance will make America competitive again, former U.S. Patent Office director says
item.description: China leads in 37 of 44 critical technologies, Andrei Iancu, who served as director of the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office under Trump, warns.

item.title: How FTX’s Young Executives Shattered Their Parents
item.description: As their children are sentenced for fraud, the parents of FTX’s top leaders have described their disbelief at how the crypto exchange upended their li...

item.title: Clean Energy Is Booming in the U.S. The Election Could Change That.
item.description: Trump has suggested he would dismantle the Inflation Reduction Act, which has reshaped America’s energy landscape. It won’t be easy.

item.title: Music and Morale in a Country at War
item.description: In Ukraine, where war feels omnipresent, music is helping lift spirits and raise money for the military.
